alert.note: Alert for Pike; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 8:16PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sullivan, southeastern Wayne and Pike Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 815 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Grahamsville to near Tobyhanna. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fallsburg, Bushkill, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Liberty, Bethel, Paupack, Neversink and South Fallsburg. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 100 and 116. Interstate 84 between 20 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
